intro: Blepharodon grandiflorum subsp. grandiflorum, commonly known as the large-flowered blepharodon, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically range in color from yellow to orange. The plant belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is known for its ornamental value in gardens. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sun exposure. The subspecies is distinguished by its larger flower size compared to other related species.
